meta_description: Armory Center for the Arts is a nonprofit visual arts organization in Pasadena, CA. Guided by a mission to nurture our community and its young people by creating, learning, and presenting art to advance equity and social justice, we envision joyful, healthy, and equitable communities shaped by imagination, creativity, and diverse voices.
hours_text:
# Plan Your Visit

#### Location

Armory Center for the Arts serves its community from _The Gale Kohl Center for Creativity_ in Old Pasadena, a historic 1932 California Guard Armory located at [145 North Raymond Avenue](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Armory+Center+For+the+Arts/@34.1484452,-118.1512869,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x80c2c37222f2ed8d:0x478013e108132e1c!8m2!3d34.1484452!4d-118.1490982), [ Pasadena, California 91103](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Armory+Center+For+the+Arts/@34.1484452,-118.1512869,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x80c2c37222f2ed8d:0x478013e108132e1c!8m2!3d34.1484452!4d-118.1490982).

[Read Visitor & Student Policies](https://www.armoryarts.org/visit/visitor-student-policies)

#### Hours of Operation

**Administrative Office Hours**  
Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM (by appointment only).

**Gallery Hours**  
Armory galleries are open Thrusdays, Fridays, and Saturdays, 1:00 to 5:00 PM. Admission is always free.  
  
**2026 Holiday Closures**  
The Armory is closed New Year's Day, MLK Day, President's Day, Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Independence Day (July 3 observed), Labor Day, Thanksgiving, and from Christmas Eve through New Year's Eve.

#### Parking

  * Old Pasadena Park & Walk Garages:  
0-2 Hours $1.00  
$2.00 per hour for every hour thereafter  
$12.00 Daily Max  

  * Street parking doesn't charge before 11 am on weekdays.  

  * To learn more about parking, [view parking options in Old Pasadena.](https://www.oldpasadena.org/visi...

collections_text:
# Exhibitions

[ ](/exhibitions/2026/material-prophecies)

Opening February 20, 2026  **[Material Prophecies: Craft as Divination](/exhibitions/2026/material-prophecies)**

This group exhibition features artists turn to craft to divine memory, enact ritual, and seek knowledge of the future.

[ ](/exhibitions/2025/sanctuaries)

Through February 28, 2026  **[Sanctuaries](/exhibitions/2025/sanctuaries)**

Sanctuaries is a group exhibition where artists expound the meaning and imagination of the true and metaphysical sanctuaries that co-exist as protection, agency, preservation, and healing. 

[ ](https://armory-center-for-the-arts.square.site/)

**[Get the Catalogue: From the Ground Up](https://armory-center-for-the-arts.square.site/)**

Edited by exhibition curator Irene Georgia Tsatsos, contributors include Olivia Chumacero, Sean C. Lahmeyer, Hillary Mushkin, Enid Baxter Ryce, and David Delgado Shorter, PhD.

[ ](/visit/field-trips)

**[K-12 Exhibition Field Trips](/visit/field-trips)**

_From the Ground Up_ field trips are booking now. Every student makes an artwork related to the exhibition's themes that they can take home.
